author: sunnysidedj_42398
content: Hi, I'm from Sunnyside Labs testing PeerDAS with <@288990561279541248>. I'm not sure whether this has been already discussed, but found an issue on a prysm-nethermind supernode instance.

author: sunnysidedj_42398
content:
The instance couldn't follow the chain after giving following errors.
Prysm returns errors for all sidecars (128 times for each index), e.g.
`[2025-04-22 10:59:27.94] ERROR sync: Sidecar index out of range - should never happen index=20`
I think this happens because it fails to reconstruct data column sidecars from the received block, but am not sure whether this error can be ignored.
After a while, a reorg happened and block height no longer increased.

Could Prysm team have a look?

author: sunnysidedj_42398
content:
Images used:
prysm: docker.ethquokkaops.io/dh/ethpandaops/prysm-beacon-chain:peerDAS-linux-amd64-eeb3cdc
nethermind: docker.ethquokkaops.io/dh/ethpandaops/nethermind:feature-peerdas
SSH: ssh devops@prysm-nethermind-3.peerdas-devnet-ssl-15.yolkie.xyz
Grafana: http://94.130.19.237:3000/d/dsfasdfasf/network-monitor?orgId=1&from=2025-04-22T10:53:49.868Z&to=2025-04-22T11:17:16.114Z&timezone=utc&var-network=peerdas-devnet-ssl-15&var-consensus=$__all&var-execution=$__all&refresh=1m&var-group_by=supernode,consensus_client

author: parithosh
content:
I bumped up all lighthouse-geth nodes to 16GB ram hosts. They all checkpoint synced from a lh-nethermind-3 node, so seem to have the same head. Both EL + CL have peers. 

The node still isn't moving at all, these are fully wiped and restarted nodes (so should be new enr in theory). 

Any ideas? failing which, our only option is to scrap devnet-6.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: On a prysm node I see `WARN [04-23|04:06:35.214] Ignoring already known beacon payload    number=46594 hash=919c07..4a2737 age=5d11h9m  ` which means the CL gives us a 5 day old payloads
